title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Hi,

I have an A1708 that only has image on external display.

Client said that it was listening music, and the display died.

Already tried 2 known good displays, with same result.

Not sure if the problem is backlight or image, but I can't see nothing on the display, even with a flashlight

PP5V_S0_BKLT_D = 5V
LCDBKLT_FET_DRV = 0V
ISNS_LCDBKLT_N = 13V
ISNS_LCDBKLT_P = 13V
BKLT_EN_R = 3.3V
PP5V_S0_BKLT_A = 5V
BKLT_SENSE_OUT = 0V
LCDBKLT_FB = 0V
PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT = 0V

PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT starts at 0.150V and them drops to 0.050V.

Not sure if D8410 is good, because voltage is passing through both pins (I think that in diode reading it only should have voltage in one way, correct?)

Can you help?

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message: Check HPD signal from video connector; with LCD assembly connected, of course.

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Do you get 5V_S0SW_LCD?
Check voltage and diode on I2C_BKLT_SCL/SDA lines.

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Yes, I have 5V on PP5V_S0SW_LCD.

I2C_BKLT_SCL:
5V
0.508 diode reading

I2C_BKLT_SDA:
4.5V
0.511 diode reading

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message: Check diode mode on J8500's EDP data lines.

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Hi.

EDP_INT_AUX_N = OL
EDP_INT_AUX_P = OL
EDP_INT_ML_N<0> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_P<0> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_N<1> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_P<1> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_N<2> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_P<2> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_N<3> = OL
EDP_INT_ML_P<3> = OL

BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN = 0.718
EDP_BKLT_PWM = 0.786

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
I forgot this board has series capacitors for data lines.
You should check on the other side of the capacitors.

"Not sure if D8410 is good, because [B]voltage is passing through both pin[/B]s"
I'm not sure what this means...

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
EDP_INT_AUX_N = 0.255
EDP_INT_AUX_P = 0.258
EDP_INT_ML_N<0> = 0.256
EDP_INT_ML_P<0> = 0.260
EDP_INT_ML_N<1> = 0.258
EDP_INT_ML_P<1> = 0.258
EDP_INT_ML_N<2> = 0.259
EDP_INT_ML_P<2> = 0.260
EDP_INT_ML_N<3> = 0.259
EDP_INT_ML_P<3> = 0.259
[B][/B]

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message: Can you detail more about D8410?

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Hi.

I'll try to explain what I mean:

When measuring the diodo D8410 with the multimeter, and placing the positive tip on one of the diode pads (pad1), and the negative tip on the other diode pad (pad2), I think that current should only pass from one side of the diode (value reading in diode).

If I invert the position of the multimeter tips (the positive one on pad 2 of the diode and the negative one on pad 1), the diode reading should be 0.

This is not happening. Even reversing the test tips, I always have diode readings above 0.

Did I you understod? Is this thought correct? How do I test schottky diodos in a proper way?

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Correct, if you test it out of board!
Onboard measuring is affected by other components.

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
OK. I've mesured it onboard. That explain the reading. Out of board, I get the right reading.

However, it seams that I have a problem on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT, cause diodo reading is 0.105. I think it should be higher (dont have other board to compare it).

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Is that without LCD connected?
Then should have a bad filter capacitor.

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message:
Yes, it is with the board alone on the desk.

Can I inject voltage there?

title: A1708 820-00840-A no image
message: You can, but probably need an IR camera to find the culprit.
